title: SRE vs DevOps: A Side-by-Side Comparison
author: Nikhil
summary: Explore the key differences and similarities between Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) and DevOps through a clear side-by-side comparison of their tools and responsibilities.
content:
## SRE vs DevOps: A Side-by-Side Comparison

In today’s fast-paced engineering environments, two practices stand out when it comes to building scalable and reliable systems: **DevOps** and **Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)**. While they share some goals and tools, their philosophies and focuses can differ significantly.

Here’s a clear comparison to help you understand both roles and how they align with your organization’s needs:

### 🧰 Tooling & Focus Areas

| Category                           | DevOps Engineer Tools                            | SRE (Site Reliability Engineer) Tools             |
|------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------|
| **Linux Administration**           | CLI or GUI tools                                 | CLI and GUI tools                                |
| **Scripting**                      | Bash, Python                                     | Bash, Python                                     |
| **Cloud Platforms**                | AWS, Azure, GCP for Cloud                        | AWS, Azure, GCP for Cloud                        |
| **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)**   | Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible               | Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible               |
| **CI/CD**                          | Jenkins, GitLab, CircleCI                        | *(Primarily handled by DevOps)*                  |
| **Containerization**              | Docker, Kubernetes                               | *(Used as part of deployment stack)*             |
| **Configuration Management**       | *(Often included in IaC tools)*                  | Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible               |
| **Monitoring & Observability**     | *(Basic tools depending on use case)*            | New Relic, DataDog, Kibana, Grafana              |
| **Incident Response**              | *(Usually integrates with ops teams)*            | Opsgenie, VictorOps (Splunk On-call), PagerDuty  |

### 🎯 Key Philosophical Differences

- **DevOps** emphasizes **collaboration** between development and operations teams to deliver code faster and more reliably.
- **SRE** applies a **software engineering approach** to IT operations with a focus on system reliability, automation, and scalability.

### 📝 Final Thoughts

DevOps and SRE are not competitors — they are **complementary disciplines**. Organizations benefit most when both practices work together to foster rapid delivery and robust reliability.*
